info.title: Credit Sense API
info.description:
The Credit Sense API allows you to:
- Create, manage, and send quick links.
- Grant access permissions for applications to another Store.
- Manage refresh authorities and trigger refreshes on existing applications.
- Provide transaction data that we'll use to generate Credit Sense reports.
- Retrieve existing Credit Sense reports.
- Retrieve statistics on the number of applications completed.
- Retrieve statuses and metadata for applications.
- View and manage blacklisted applications.

### About these API docs
These API docs are provided in OpenAPI Specification (OAS) format for your reference. Use the `Download` button atop this page to download these API docs as an OAS 3-compliant JSON document that you can import into the API client of your choice (e.g. [Postman](https://www.postman.com/), [Insomnia](https://insomnia.rest/), [Swagger Inspector](https://inspector.swagger.io/builder)).

You can also click one of the buttons below to import the API spec into an API client you have installed.

[![Run in Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://app.getpostman.com/run-collection/da63c952ac2450a1701c)
[![Run in Insomnia}](https://insomnia.rest/images/run.svg)](https://insomnia.rest/run/?label=Credit%20Sense%20API&uri=https%3A%2F%2Frmeredithcs.github.io%2Fcredit-sense-v2-api%2FCredit-Sense-API.v2.json)

Click the chevrons next to object names and response codes to expand out the request and response schemas.
![alt text](https://rmeredithcs.github.io/credit-sense-v2-api/API_docs_guide.gif "API docs guide screen recording")

### Request URL
The request URL is built using multiple components - `{protocol}` `{base-url}` `{version}` `{api-key}` `{endpoint}`
1. All calls to the API must be made using the TLS **protocol** - `https://`
2. The **base URL** is always [api.creditsense.com.au](api.creditsense.com.au) - `https://api.creditsense.com.au`
3. The current **version** is v2 - `https://api.creditsense.com.au/v2`
4. The **API key** will be unique to your environment - `https://api.creditsense.com.au/v2/xxx-xxx-xxx`
5. The **endpont** will be determined by what you're trying to do - `https://api.creditsense.com.au/v2/xxx-xxx-xxx/exampleEndpoint`

### Authentication
Each call to the API requires:
- **API key** - identifies your account; forms part of the request URL.
- **API token** - identifies your access to the API; included in the `Settings` object in your request body.

If you don't have your API credentials or you'd like them to be changed, please [contact us](mailto:support@creditsense.com.au).

### Rate Limiting
The API is rate limited at one API call per second, with the ability to handle a burst of up to 20 API calls depending on the amount of API credits available.

#### How do API credits work?
- Every API call uses an API credit. 
- Your account receives one API credit every one second and can accrue a maximum of 20 credits at any time.
- When your API credits run out the API will return a '429 - Too Many Requests' status code, indicating that you will need to retry your API call after waiting for your API credit balance to increase.

post.description:
### Overview
Trigger a refresh for one or more existing applications.

Reasons to use this endpoint:
- Generate a new Credit Sense report with the latest transaction history.
- Monitor a customer's account balance to determine the best time to process a loan repayment.

### Requirements
In order to refresh the application successfully, the following requirements must be met:

1. A valid App ID must be provided.
2. The application needs a valid and active refresh authority.
3. The Store that owns the refresh application needs to have a refresh Store linked.
4. The Client that owns the refresh application needs to have a valid provider (e.g. Yodlee v12).
5. The credential of the refresh application doesn't require MFA verification.

### Priority
When an application is refreshed as a priority, it will be processed first in the queue. Each Client has a certain number of applications that can be set as priority. If the number of priority applications reaches the limit, the system will ignore the priority settings and refresh any remaining applications as normal priority. 

### Additional information
If a refresh is triggered on a completed application, the system will create a new application. Whereas if a refresh is triggered on an incomplete or unsuccessful application, it will refresh the existing application.

Once a refresh is completed, an email and/or webhook call may be made, dependent on the Client and Store configuration.

API_Token.description: The unique token that identifies your API access privileges.

Raise_Error.description:
The error code you specify will be returned in the response. 
This is used for testing purposes only.

App_ID.description: Our unique identifier for the application to be refreshed.

New_App_Ref.description: Your reference assigned to the new application. If not provided, your reference from the  original application will be used with "\_refresh" appended to it.

Is_priority.description:
If set to true, the refresh will be processed as a priority.
Each Store has a limit of priority applications in the queue. By default, the Store queue limit is set to 10.

Copy_Existing_Data.description:
If set to true, the existing application will be copied to the Refresh store *without* triggering an actual refresh (i.e. no new bank pull will occur). 
This is usually only used in specific circumstances.

No_Delivery.description:
If set to true, the configured delivery methods (e.g. email, webhook, etc.) on the store will be ignored for the refresh. 
This can be useful if you intend to poll the `/app/search` endpoint to monitor the status of the application. 
This is usually only used in specific circumstances and may be used in conjunction with `Copy_Existing_Data`.

requestBody.description:
### Raising errors during testing
Pass an error code from the below table into `$.Settings.Raise_Error` to see how your implementation handles different errors being returned in the response.

| HTTP status codes | Error code | Error type            | Error description                                                                                                               |
|-------------------|------------|-----------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 207               | 207        | Multi-Status          | The message body can contain a number of separate response codes, depending on how many sub-requests were made.                 |
|                   | 207.1      | Invalid Post          | Invalid AppID.                                                                                                                  |
|                   | 207.2      | Invalid Post          | Invalid provider.                                                                                                               |
|                   | 207.3      | Invalid Post          | Cannot refresh an application that requires MFA.                                                                                |
|                   | 207.4      | Invalid Post          | Unable to refresh as the application doesn't belong to the store with enabled refresh service.                                  |
|                   | 207.5      | Data Error            | The customer is not authorised for a refresh, or the authority to refresh the customer has expired.                             |
|                   | 207.7      | Data Error            | Failed to delete the customer authority as it has expired or revoked.                                                           |
|                   | 207.9      | Data Error            | Failed to renew the authority as the application doesn't have any customer authority assigned.                                  |
|                   | 207.10     | Data Error            | Unknown error.                                                                                                                  |
|                   | 207.11     | Data Error            | Failed to refresh as the application can't call Yodlee v12 API.                                                                 |
|                   | 207.12     | Data Error            | Failed to refresh as another refresh is in process.                                                                             |
|                   | 207.13     | Data Error            | Failed to refresh as the customer bank account is in use by another refresh.                                                    |
|                   | 207.14     | Data Error            | Failed to renew the authority as it has been revoked by the customer.                                                           |
| 400               | 400        | Bad Request           | The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error.                                              |
|                   | 400.1      | Bad Request           | The request could not be correctly parsed due to syntax error or missing the required data.                                     |
|                   | 400.2      | Bad Request           | Empty post body.                                                                                                                |
| 401               | 401        | Unauthorized          | Similar to 403 Forbidden, but specifically for use when authentication is required and has failed or has not yet been provided. |
|                   | 401.1      | Unauthorized          | Invalid API key.                                                                                                                |
|                   | 401.2      | Unauthorized          | Invalid API token.                                                                                                              |
|                   | 401.3      | Unauthorized          | Invalid API key/token.                                                                                                          |
| 403               | 403        | Forbidden             | Access denied.                                                                                                                  |
| 422               | 422        | Unprocessable Entity  | The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.                                               |
|                   | 422.1      | Unprocessable Entity  | No applications provided.                                                                                                       |
|                   | 422.2      | Unprocessable Entity  | The raise error code is not found.                                                                                              |
| 429               | 429        | Too Many Requests     | API calls exceed a maximum of calls per minute limit.                                                                           |
| 500               | 500        | Internal server error | Internal server error.                                                                                                          |
| 501               | 501        | Not Implemented       | Invalid command.                                                                                                                |
| 503               | 503.1      | Service Unavailable   | Unable to service your request at this time. Please try again later.                                                            |

post.description:
### Overview
Set the active refresh authority on one or more applications as inactive and cancel the refresh on the applications.

Reasons to use this endpoint:
- A customer's loan term ends and you no longer wish to maintain ongoing access to their updated transaction history.
- A customer requests you to remove the ability to access their bank account information.

### Requirements
In order to set the refresh authority for an application as inactive, the following requirements must be met:

1. A valid App ID must be provided.
2. The application needs a valid and active refresh authority assigned.

API_Token.description: The unique token that identifies your API access privileges.

Raise_Error.description:
The error code you specify will be returned in the response. 
This is used for testing purposes only.

App_ID.description: Our unique identifier for the application to delete the refresh authority for.

post.description:
### Overview
Trigger a renewal on the authority of the applications provided.

**This endpoint is disabled by default. [Contact us](mailto:support@creditsense.com.au) for more information.**

Reasons to use this endpoint:
- Extend the expiration date for the authority to access a customer's transaction history.

### Requirements
In order to extend the expiration date for a refresh authority on an application, the following requirements must be met:

1. A valid App ID must be provided.
2. The application needs a valid and active refresh authority assigned.
3. The refresh authority was not revoked by the customer.

API_Token.description: The unique token that identifies your API access privileges.

Raise_Error.description:
The error code you specify will be returned in the response. 
This is used for testing purposes only.

App_ID.description: Our unique identifier for the application to renew the refresh authority for.

post.description:
### Overview
Retrieve reports in the requested formats for a specified application.

Data in `$.Response` is provided in an identical format to the webhook delivery of Credit Sense reports and supporting documents.

This API delivers the Credit Sense report and supporting documents in `$.Response.attachments.content` as a base64 encoded string. Information about an application ('metadata') is returned in addition to an array of attachments that can contain different document types (HTML, JSON, PDF, XML). To ensure that the metadata and attachments form valid JSON, we encode the attachments (using standard base64 encoding). If we didn't do this, any HTML, PDF, or XML attachments could break the API because they may contain content that is cannot be included in valid JSON.

Reasons to use this endpoint:
- Retrieve a Credit Sense report in data formats (JSON, XML).
- Retrieve a Credit Sense report in visual formats (HTML, PDF).
- Retrieve supporting documents attached to Credit Sense a report.

post.description:
### Overview
Retrieve applications that match the specified search criteria. 

Reasons to use this endpoint:
- Monitor for completed applications via periodic polling (as an alternative to or in conjunction with asynchronous webhooks).
- Check the status of an in-progress application based on the App ID or reference.
- Check for failed/errored applications.

### Date format
Dates included in your request in `$.Payload.Date_Range.From` and `$.Payload.Date_Range.To` are expected in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format. i.e. `yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss.fff T`

| Portion | Example | Description                                                |
|---------|---------|------------------------------------------------------------|
| yyyy    | 2016    | The full year                                              |
| MM      | 04      | The month, with leading zeros                              |
| dd      | 08      | The day, with leading zeros                                |
| hh      | 16      | Hours (24 hour time), with leading zeros                   |
| mm      | 45      | Minutes, with leading zeros                                |
| ss      | 53      | Seconds, with leading zeros                                |
| .fff    | .654300 | Factions of a second, 6 decimal places with trailing zeros |
| T       | +10:00  | The timezone offset                                        |

**Notes:**
- If you provide your local time, make sure you include your timezone offset.
- Dates will be returned in UTC.
- Although ISO standard dates support providing only the date portion, to avoid confusion it is recommended you always pass full date and time for the `$.Payload.Date_Range.To` object. If no time is provided, the default `00:00:00.000000` time is assumed.

### Pagination
A maximum of 500 results will be returned for calls to this endpoint. If you receive a `$.Response.Total` that is larger than the `$.Response.Count`, you should repeat the call but with `$.Payload.Date_Range.From` set to the returned `$.Response.Last_App_Dt`, to get the rest of the applications. You may need to do this multiple times to get all of the available applications.

### Duplicate applications
It is possible to receive the same application in different date ranges. It's important that you handle this accordingly.

There are two reasons this happens: 
1. When applications are changed in some way, their `$.Response.Applications.Modify_Dt` will change, making them applicable for different date ranges. 
2. If your search returns more than the maximum number of results, when the results are returned paginated you may have the last application of your _first_ call appear as the first of your _second_ call. See the example below.

#### Example
| App | Modify_Dt | Returned in    |
|-----|-----------|----------------|
| A   | 1         | Call 1         |
| B   | 2         | Call 1         |
| C   | 2         | Call 1         |
| D   | 2         | Call 1         |
| E   | 3         | Call 1, Call 2 |
| F   | 3         |         Call 2 |
| G   | 4         |         Call 2 |

**Call 1 response** `$.Response.Count: 5`, `$.Response.Total: 7`, `$.Response.Last_App_Date: 3`

**Call 2 request** `$.Payload.Date_Range.From: 3` | **Call 2 response** `$.Response.Count: 3`, `$.Response.Total: 3`, `$.Response.Last_App_Date: 4`

### Overview
Add an applicant to your blacklist for use in Lead Market.

When an application is provided to this endpoint, we'll identify the customer based on this and any related applications they've completed and blacklist them.

**In order to use this API endpoint we need to create a blacklist for you and enable access to it for your environment. Please contact us to have this feature configured.**

Reasons to use this endpoint:
- Avoid buying the same lead again in Lead Market by blacklisting the customer based on their Credit Sense report.

### Raising errors during testing
Pass an error code from the below table into `$.Settings.Raise_Error` to see how your implementation handles different errors being returned in the response.

| HTTP status codes | Error code | Error type            | Error description                                                                                                               |
|-------------------|------------|-----------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 400               | 400        | Bad Request           | The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error.                                              |
|                   | 400.1      | Bad Request           | The request could not be correctly parsed due to syntax error or missing the required data.                                     |
|                   | 400.2      | Bad Request           | Empty post body.                                                                                                                |
| 401               | 401        | Unauthorized          | Similar to 403 Forbidden, but specifically for use when authentication is required and has failed or has not yet been provided. |
|                   | 401.1      | Unauthorized          | Invalid API key.                                                                                                                |
|                   | 401.2      | Unauthorized          | Invalid API token.                                                                                                              |
|                   | 401.3      | Unauthorized          | Invalid API key/token.                                                                                                          |
| 403               | 403        | Forbidden             | Access denied.                                                                                                                  |
| 422               | 422        | Unprocessable Entity  | The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.                                               |
|                   | 422.2      | Unprocessable Entity  | The raise error code is not found.                                                                                              |

### Raising errors during testing
Pass an error code from the below table into `$.Settings.Raise_Error` to see how your implementation handles different errors being returned in the response.

| Error code | Error type             | Error description                                     |
|------------|------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------|
| 0          | Authentication failure | Invalid API_Key or API_Token                          |
| 1          | Invalid XML            | No or multiple application data found                 |
| 2          | Invalid XML            | No source data found                                  |
| 3          | Invalid XML            | No account data found                                 |
| 4          | Authentication failure | Authentication failure, invalid ClientCode            |
| 5          | Invalid Data           | Reference provided already exists                     |
| 6          | Invalid Data           | Invalid sourceTypeID                                  |
| 7          | Invalid Data           | Invalid accountType                                   |
| 8          | Invalid Data           | Invalid transaction type (must be credit/debit)       |
| 9          | Invalid Data           | Application failed to add                             |
| 10         | Invalid Data           | Source failed to add                                  |
| 11         | Invalid Data           | Account failed to add                                 |
| 12         | Invalid Data           | Transactions failed to add                            |
| 100        | Database Connectivity  | We are unable to connect to the database at this time |

### Raising errors during testing
Pass an error code from the below table into `$.Settings.Raise_Error` to see how your implementation handles different errors being returned in the response.

| Error code | Error type             | Error description                                                |
|------------|------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 1          | Data Error             | There was an error in processing.                                |
| 99         | Unknown Error          | Unknown Error                                                    |
| 100        | Database Connectivity  | We are unable to connect to the database at this time            |
| 101        | Invalid Post           | Missing post parameters. (The missing parameters will be listed) |
| 102        | Authentication failure | Invalid API_Key or API_Token                                     |
